{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3354301,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T21:50:02.158Z","cooked":"

You know I’m not afraid to wear my ignorance like a badge…and too lazy to scroll through the hundreds of replies about the new radio in the thread that started on Jan 5…
So - looking at the “recommended” POE plus 12V for redundancy - what do we use for the POE power injector?
The orange POE Rev injector cable?

Haven’t used that POE injector cable since the RPM has been available - but remember folks saying they had issues with it?
An old FRC urban myth?

https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/~gitbook/image?url=https:%2F%2F4239402461-files.gitbook.io%2F~%2Ffiles%2Fv0%2Fb%2Fgitbook-x-prod.appspot.com%2Fo%2Fspaces%252FzaDthb1gXvbj84qIfOUE%252Fuploads%252FafjlttMTCnRcZ8Q4XiE7%252FVivid%2520Wirings_Using%2520an%2520Ethernet%2520Switch_VH-109%2520(PoE%2520%252B%2520Redundant%2520Power)_VH-109%2520(PoE%2520%252B%2520Redundant%2520Power).jpg%3Falt=media%26token=2950af24-98df-44c8-962b-86d30d7fdf65&width=768&dpr=4&quality=100&sign=0238e86282a6d07ae3b21e642ab16fa17e7110fb6f7f776f7f1c2a066ae0c0dc

The orange POE injector cable is one option, adafruit has some, and there are more out there 3rd party if you dig.

Regardless of your selected passive POE injector, if you plan to make make redundant power connections they need to be the same potential as I think you know/read.

So do NOT use a REV RPM for POE @18V DC, and then send 12V DC to the weidmuller terminations from the PDH or PDP. That will supposedly cause damage.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T23:32:32.579Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":63.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461608,"topic_slug":"poe-and-12vdc-for-new-radio-power-redundancy","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/poe-and-12vdc-for-new-radio-power-redundancy/461608/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3354411,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T23:50:42.770Z","cooked":"

Thanks - right, no mixing 18V RPM with 12V PDH.

I havent had any issues with RPMs, except a cracked case last year (our fault - and it still worked) - but now we have the ability for redundant radio power, so I’m now (over)thinking about the pros/cons of adding a POE injector cable with ethernet cable (stuff that could fail) versus just the RPM which could also fail.

These are good decisions to have to make - better than “how do I keep that damn barrel connection from coming out of the radio”

The diagram from Vivid Hosting shows a male to male cable with 12V injection. Does anyone know of a COTS solution for this? The REV cable is female to male and I would like one less connection point, if available.

What did everyone at CMP do?

Screenshot 2024-05-15 at 12.29.07 PM1590×1226 97.2 KB

How many amps does it draw? We used one of these to power our two limelight cameras this year and it worked well:

4 Ports Passive RJ45 PoE Power Injection Module, Power Over Ethernet Injector https://a.co/d/aIP4luV

Each port has a resetting fuse and outputs 720mA.

The other POE devices coming from the radio will be using the same power as the radio. The current rules seem to prohibit this. That might well change with new rules. I am superstitious. I will not be using the POE from the radio to power other devices. Others are free to do what they want at their own peril.
